name: Djamo
headline: Challenger Bank for consumers in French speaking Africa.
description: Djamo is a challenger Bank for consumers in french speaking Africa where less than 25% of the population is banked, we are building seamless and affordable banking solutions to break into this huge untaped market and bring millions of people into financial inclusion.

founders.name: Hassan Bourgi, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder and CEO
B2C product-devoted founder, ex-Founder and CEO of Busportal sold to RedBus (Naspers) in 2019

founders.name: Regis Bamba, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder & CPO/CTO
Former telco product manager with strong technical background.
built Mobile Money & banking products with millions in revenue.

generated_description:
**Djamo: The Challenger Bank Busting Barriers in West Africa**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from the bustling city of Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, Djamo is not just another fintech company; it's pioneering a movement to democratize banking in French-speaking Africa. With an astounding less than 25% of the population banked, Djamo's mission is clear: to create seamless and affordable banking solutions that usher millions into the world of financial inclusion. As a member of Y Combinator's Winter 2021 batch, the company is backed by expert mentors and investors, including Group Partner Nicolas Dessaigne.

At its core, Djamo is developing a super app—a comprehensive financial tool that allows users to manage all aspects of their money from their mobile devices. The convenience of accessing financial services at their fingertips is a game-changer in a region where traditional banking has often been out of reach for many. With over 1.5 million downloads and a stellar 4.7 rating, the app is gaining traction among its users, illustrating a strong demand for innovative financial solutions.

Djamo employs a talented team of 160 individuals who are committed to breaking into this vast untapped market. They focus not just on creating a banking platform but on an overarching vision of transforming financial experiences for millions. 

Just two years into its journey, Djamo is setting the stage for a financial revolution in West Africa—placing control back into the hands of consumers and redefining what banking means in the region.

For those interested in exploring Djamo or downloading their app, you can find more information on their [website](https://www.djamo.com).
